fr:title.text: Formalized Soundness and Completeness of Epistemic Logic

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Formalized Soundness and Completeness of Epistemic Logic
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: International Workshop on Logical Aspects in Multi-Agent Systems and Strategic Reasoning (LAMAS & SR 2021)

@unpublished{FromJV21a, abstract = {Epistemic logic allows reasoning about the knowledge of agents, and deductive proof systems enable this reasoning with a few axioms and inference rules. We strengthen the logical foundations of such a system by formalizing it in the proof assistant Isabelle/HOL. Our definitions are given in the precise language of higher-order logic and every step of our soundness and completeness proofs is mechanically checked.}, author = {Asta Halkjær From and Alexander Birch Jensen and Jørgen Villadsen}, note = {International Workshop on Logical Aspects in Multi-Agent Systems and Strategic Reasoning (LAMAS & SR 2021), accepted abstract}, title = {Formalized Soundness and Completeness of Epistemic Logic}, url = {https://lamassr.github.io/editions/2021/papers/Formalized-Soundness.pdf}, year = {2021}, }

fr:mainmatter.html:p: Epistemic logic allows reasoning about the knowledge of agents, and deductive proof systems enable this reasoning with a few axioms and inference rules. We strengthen the logical foundations of such a system by formalizing it in the proof assistant Isabelle/HOL. Our definitions are given in the precise language of higher-order logic and every step of our soundness and completeness proofs is mechanically checked.
